domains.description: Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects. Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the other objects in their object group.

types.description: Mirror object referencing original JavaScript object.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Object class (constructor) name. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Remote object value in case of primitive values or JSON values (if it was requested), or description string if the value can not be JSON-stringified (like NaN, Infinity, -Infinity, -0).

properties.name: preview
properties.description: Preview containing abbreviated property values. Specified for object type values only.

types.description: Object containing abbreviated remote object value.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: overflow
properties.description: True iff some of the properties or entries of the original object did not fit.

properties.name: entries
properties.description: List of the entries. Specified for map and set subtype values only.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Object type. Accessor means that the property itself is an accessor property.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Preview of the key. Specified for map-like collection entries.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

properties.name: writable
properties.description: True if the value associated with the property may be changed (data descriptors only).

properties.name: get
properties.description: A function which serves as a getter for the property, or undefined if there is no getter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: set
properties.description: A function which serves as a setter for the property, or undefined if there is no setter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: configurable
properties.description: True if the type of this property descriptor may be changed and if the property may be deleted from the corresponding object.

properties.name: enumerable
properties.description: True if this property shows up during enumeration of the properties on the corresponding object.

properties.name: wasThrown
properties.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

properties.name: isOwn
properties.description: True if the property is owned for the object.

properties.name: symbol
properties.description: Property symbol object, if the property is of the symbol type.

types.description: Object internal property descriptor. This property isn't normally visible in JavaScript code.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

types.description: Represents function call argument. Either remote object id objectId or primitive value or neither of (for undefined) them should be specified.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Primitive value, or description string if the value can not be JSON-stringified (like NaN, Infinity, -Infinity, -0).

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique id of the execution context. It can be used to specify in which execution context script evaluation should be performed.

properties.name: isDefault
properties.description: Whether context is the default page context (as opposite to e.g. context of content script).

properties.name: name
properties.description: Human readable name describing given context.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Id of the owning frame. May be an empty string if the context is not associated with a frame.

types.description: Detailed information on exception (or error) that was thrown during script compilation or execution.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script ID of the message origin.

properties.name: line
properties.description: Line number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: JavaScript stack trace for assertions and error messages.

types.description: Stack entry for runtime errors and assertions.
Call frames for assertions or error messages.

properties.name: description
properties.description: String label of this stack trace. For async traces this may be a name of the function that initiated the async call.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: Asynchronous JavaScript stack trace that preceded this stack, if available.

parameters.description: Specifies in which isolated context to perform evaluation. Each content script lives in an isolated context and this parameter may be used to specify one of those contexts. If the parameter is omitted or 0 the evaluation will be performed in the context of the inspected page.

domains.description: Console domain defines methods and events for interaction with the JavaScript console. Console collects messages created by means of the JavaScript Console API. One needs to enable this domain using enable command in order to start receiving the console messages. Browser collects messages issued while console domain is not enabled as well and reports them using messageAdded notification upon enabling.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script ID of the message origin.

properties.name: line
properties.description: Line number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Message parameters in case of the formatted message.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: JavaScript stack trace for assertions and error messages.

properties.name: networkRequestId
properties.description: Identifier of the network request associated with this message.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Timestamp, when this message was fired.

properties.name: executionContextId
properties.description: Identifier of the context where this message was created

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables console domain, sends the messages collected so far to the client by means of the messageAdded notification.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables console domain, prevents further console messages from being reported to the client.

commands.name: clearMessages
commands.description: Clears console messages collected in the browser.

parameters.name: message

events.description: Is not issued. Will be gone in the future versions of the protocol.

events.description: Issued when console is cleared. This happens either upon clearMessages command or after page navigation.

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an id. This id can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that iframe owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

types.description: Unique DOM node identifier used to reference a node that may not have been pushed to the front-end.
Backend node with a friendly name.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the nodeId. Backend will only push node with given id once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

properties.name: children
properties.description: Child nodes of this node when requested with children.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: Attributes of the Element node in the form of flat array [name1, value1, name2, value2].

properties.name: documentURL
properties.description: Document URL that Document or FrameOwner node points to.

properties.name: baseURL
properties.description: Base URL that Document or FrameOwner node uses for URL completion.

properties.name: xmlVersion
properties.description: Document's XML version in case of XML documents.

properties.name: pseudoType
properties.description: Pseudo element type for this node.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Frame ID for frame owner elements.

properties.name: contentDocument
properties.description: Content document for frame owner elements.

properties.name: shadowRoots
properties.description: Shadow root list for given element host.

properties.name: templateContent
properties.description: Content document fragment for template elements.

properties.name: pseudoElements
properties.description: Pseudo elements associated with this node.

properties.name: importedDocument
properties.description: Import document for the HTMLImport links.

properties.name: distributedNodes
properties.description: Distributed nodes for given insertion point.

types.description: DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes. DOMNode is a base node mirror type.

domains.description: This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles) have an associated id used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has a specific id structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds. CSS objects can be loaded using the get*ForNode() calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client can also discover all the existing stylesheets with the getAllStyleSheets() method (or keeping track of the styleSheetAdded/styleSheetRemoved events) and subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the getStyleSheet[Text]() methods.

types.description: Stylesheet type: "injected" for stylesheets injected via extension, "user-agent" for user-agent stylesheets, "inspector" for stylesheets created by the inspector (i.e. those holding the "via inspector" rules), "regular" for regular stylesheets.
